page.title: 09Principal Features.
page.content: Although the area is crossed by 3 major communications routes,there remains poor access for the public. a) The Worcester - Malvern railway is rumoured for closure by B R. The nearest stations are Malvern Link and Foregate Street, Worcester. b) The main A449 Worcester - Malvern road has been greatly improved during the past 20 yrs. It was marked as a 3 lane road,but it was changed back to 2 lanes after numerous accidents. It carries many thousand vehicles more each day than it was designed for. The new bridge across the R. Severn, 2km to the NE was opened in 1984 and has improved access to the M5,reducing delays for through traffic. c) The B4424 Upton Rd from Powick roundabout is busiest in June,on the 3 days of The 3 Counties Show,near Malvern Wells.
